result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah D Young-Bolden

defendant.name: Young-Bolden, Isaiah D
defendant.address: 309 East Burleigh Street # Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt:
Branch 2 authorizes transfer from  Branch 30 for purposes of a global resolution.  
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Isaiah D Young-Bolden not in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Isaiah D Young-Bolden.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Court waived defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel was recently appointed and has received discovery and an offer from the state and requests status date to determine case posture. 
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter in Branch 2 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 2 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah D Young-Bolden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Isaiah D Young-Bolden.  Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Motion to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 ENHANCERS for lack of probable cause by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause as to the charges only.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense request Indigency Hearing at next hearing. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with HD; SY
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
